p: Until recently, ZIKV was not considered a serious public health threat, and thus its biology has not been studied in great detail. Hsp’s have been found to be critical factors for the pathogenesis of many viruses [ 27]. For example, HIV, rotavirus, and influenza virus replication are negatively regulated by Hsp70, whereas dengue, Japanese encephalitis, hepatitis C and Hazara viruses utilize Hsp70 for replication [ 17, 18, 21, 28–31]. Here, we have shown that Hsp70 is involved in multiple steps of the ZIKV life cycle ranging from cell entry to replication and virus egress, highlighting its essential role in virus infection.
